info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 11 at 1:03AM PDT until June 11 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...LAKE WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Lake Wind Advisory, northwest winds 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. For the Heat Advisory, temperatures up to 96 expected. For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties. * WHEN...For the Lake Wind Advisory, from noon today to 10 PM PDT this evening. For the Heat Advisory, from noon today to 8 PM PDT this evening. For the Wind Advisory, from 11 AM to 8 PM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Now is the time to secure loose outdoor items such as patio furniture, holiday decorations, and trash cans before winds increase which could blow these items away.
